question: Which city has launched India’s first Flood Forecasting and Early Warning System (FFEWS)?
explanation: The Mayor of  Kolkata Municipal Corporaton (KMC) has recently launched India\'s first Flood Forecasting and Early Warning System (FFEWS) for Kolkata City to help city officials and citizens act decisively to minimize damage before and during disasters.   India’s first comprehensive city-level \'FFEWS\' will reduce economic loss and impacts on livelihood and improve flood awareness and safety at community level. The Asian Development Bank (ADB) funded the design and implementation of the FFEWS through a $1 million technical assistance to KMC from its Urban Climate Change Resilience Trust Fund under the Urban Financing Partnership Facility.
